intro: Rothmannia leptactinioides, commonly known as the slender-leaved Rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Rothmannia leptactinioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
